content.question: Let <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the region bounded by the graph of <math alttext="y equals, the square root of x minus 1, end root" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>, the horizontal line <math alttext="y equals 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the vertical line <math alttext="x equals 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown in the figure above. Which of the following gives the volume of the solid generated when the region <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is revolved about the vertical line <math alttext="x equals 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="pi times the integral from, 0 to 2, of, open parenthesis, open parenthesis, y squared, plus 1, close parenthesis, minus 1, close parenthesis, d y" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>π</mi><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="pi times the integral from, 0 to 2, of, open parenthesis, open parenthesis, y squared, plus 1, close parenthesis, squared, minus, 1 squared, close parenthesis, d y" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>π</mi><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="pi times the integral from, 0 to 2, of, open parenthesis, open parenthesis, y squared, plus 1, close parenthesis, minus 1, close parenthesis, squared, d y" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>π</mi><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="pi times the integral from, 0 to 2, of, open parenthesis, open parenthesis, y squared, plus 1, close parenthesis, plus 1, close parenthesis, squared, d y" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>π</mi><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="pi times the integral from, 0 to 2, of, open parenthesis, open parenthesis, y squared, plus 1, close parenthesis, minus 1, close parenthesis, squared, d y" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>π</mi><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

topic.text: 8.10: Volume with Disc Method - Revolving Around Other Axes

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
